revision.text: {{COI|date=September 2015}} {{Infobox person | name = Stéphanie Gibaud | image = | caption = Stéphanie Gibaud (2015) | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1965|06|06}} | birth_place = [[Lille]] (France) | nationality = {{Flag|France}} | known_for = [[whistleblower]] | website = {{URL|www.stephaniegibaud.com}} | occupation = Marketing & communications manager}} '''Stéphanie Balique-Gibaud ''' is a public relations and an event marketing specialist. Working for [[UBS]] France in Paris, she has in particular played a decisive role in blowing the whistle on the practices of tax evasion and laundering of tax fraud in organized group of [[UBS]] AG (Switzerland) with the complicity of [[UBS]] France. == Biography == After studying languages in [[Lille]], [[France]], she worked for [[TransManche Link]] (TML, the Channel Tunnel), the embassy of the United States of America, the [[RC Lens]] football club and [[UBS]] wealth management in [[Paris]].{{cite web|author=Edwige Coupez |url=http://www.franceinfo.fr/emission/femmes-d-exception/2013-2014/evasion-fiscale-le-courage-de-stephanie-gibaud-la-femme-qui-en-savait-trop-02-16-2014-11 |title=Evasion fiscale : le courage de Stéphanie Gibaud, "La femme qui en savait trop" | France info |language=fr|publisher=Franceinfo.fr |date=2014-02-16 |accessdate=2015-08-19}} She joined [[UBS]] in 1999 where her mission was to develop partnerships with luxury brands and organise client events in France. She has played a key role in blowing the whistle and making public the fact that [[UBS]] AG has encouraged tax evasion and money laundering practices with the complicity of [[UBS]] France.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/business-22810780 |title=UBS under formal investigation in France over tax evasion - BBC News |publisher=Bbc.com |date= |accessdate=2015-08-19}} She has been acting as a [[whistleblower]] since 2008 working with French authorities and namely with the French customs. She has also been listened by the Belgian authorities ([[UBS]] Belgium being under investigation).{{cite web|author= |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2015/03/05/france-ubs-ag-idUSL5N0W74GE20150305 |title=French court rules UBS bullied ex-employee |publisher=Reuters |date=2015-03-05 |accessdate=2015-08-19}} She published a book where she explained the practices of UBS{{cite web|url=http://www.cherche-midi.com/theme/La_femme_qui_en_savait_vraiment_trop-Stephanie_GIBAUD_-9782749135083.html|title=La femme qui en savait vraiment trop - Stéphanie GIBAUD - Documents - Editions le Cherche Midi|work=cherche-midi.com}} (translation into English available in Sept. 2015). [[File:Anticor2015.jpg|upright=1.9|thumb|Anticor ethics prize 2015 ]] She received the Anticor ethics prize in January 2015{{cite web|url=https://www.dailymotion.com/video/x2gkps4_soiree-prix-ethique-contre-casseroles-2015_school?start=18|title=Soirée prix "Ethique" contre Casseroles 2015|author=ANTICOR-TV|work=Dailymotion}} before being invited to testify by the "Tax Ruling" commission of the European Parliament in Brussels. In June 2015,{{cite web|url=http://www.telam.com.ar/multimedia/video/9530-ex-directiva-del-ubs-denuncio-existencia-de-red-de-intermediarios-que-ayudaban-a-argentinos-a-fugar-divisas-y-a-evadir-al-fisco-en-caso-identico-al-hsbc/|title=Ex directiva del UBS denunció existencia de red de intermediarios que ayudaban a argentinos a fugar divisas y a evadir al fisco, en caso idéntico al HSBC - Videos - Télam - Agencia Nacional de Noticias|work=telam.com.ar}}{{cite av media|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Yv23u8EDgTQ#t=209|title=Visión 7 - HSBC: La investigación de lavado en París|date=17 June 2015|work=YouTube}} she was officially invited to an audition at the embassy of Argentina in Paris by Ricardo Echegaray, minister of finance of Argentina and the members of the argentinian "commission bicamerale"{{cite web|url=http://www.buenosairesherald.com/article/191797/hsbc-commission-to-meet-with-gibaud|title=HSBC commission to meet with Gibaud|work=buenosairesherald.com}} who are working on the mechanism of tax evasion. Stephanie Gibaud has publicly asked Argentina to bring to the G20 the question of the protection of citizens who put themselves at risk for standing up in the public interest.{{cite web|last= Febbro |first=Eduardo |url=http://www.pagina12.com.ar/diario/economia/2-275049-2015-06-17.html|title=Página/12 {{!}} Economía {{!}} "Tiré del hilo y vi cosas que no debí ver"|date=17 June 2015 |work=pagina12.com.ar}} On Septembre 10, 2015, Stéphanie Gibaud was nominated for the [[Sakharov Prize]] 2015, together with two other whistleblowers, [[Edward Snowden]] and Antoine Deltour.{{cite web|title=News {{!}} Sakharov Prize: the nominations for 2015 presented|url=http://www.europarl.europa.eu/news/en/headlines/eu-affairs/20150910STO92624/sakharov-prize-the-nominations-for-2015-presented|publisher=European Parliament|language=en|date=29 September 2015}} == The UBS case == During 8 years with [[UBS]] France, her job was to develop partnerships with luxury houses and to organize events for wealth clients of the bank on the French territory.{{cite web|url=http://www.finfacts.ie/irishfinancenews/article_1028267.shtml|title=UBS whistleblower in France criticises banking omertà|work=finfacts.ie}} In 2007, the American banker [[Bradley Birkenfeld]] story gets out. His disclosures to the United States government led to a massive fraud investigation against the Swiss bank UBS and other banks that had enabled tax evasion by U.S.taxpayers.{{cite web|url=http://www.swissinfo.ch/eng/birkenfeld-reward-may-tempt-other-bankers/33500198|title=Birkenfeld reward may tempt other bankers|work=SWI Swissinfo.ch}} All the internal procedures of the bank are thus modified everywhere in the world where [[UBS]] has offices.{{cite web|url=http://www.acp.banque-france.fr/fileadmin/user_upload/acp/publications/registre-officiel/20130626-Decision-de-la-commission-des-sanctions.pdf |format=PDF |title=AUTORITÉ DE CONTRÔLE PRUDENTIEL COMMISSION DES SANCTIONS |publisher=Acp.banque-france.fr |accessdate=2015-08-19}} In June 2008, Stephanie Gibaud was requested by her manager to delete the content of her hard drive because the office of the Paris general director was searched.{{cite web|url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/2015/03/05/uk-france-ubs-ag-idUKKBN0M122P20150305|title=French court rules UBS bullied ex-employee|work=Reuters UK}} These files contained the names and coordinates of clients and prospects of the bank as well as the names of their respective client advisors in France, Switzerland, Luxembourg, Belgium, Monaco etc. Stephanie Gibaud refused to comply with the instruction, her manager repeated her request and will also ask her to toss the content of her paper archives. A tug-of-war then started and Stephanie Gibaud complained of harassment, exclusion and discrimination.{{cite web|url=http://www.swissinfo.ch/eng/french-tax-evasion-_ubs-whistleblower-criticises-banking-s--code-of-silence-/40894464|title=UBS whistleblower criticises banking’s ‘code of silence’|work=SWI Swissinfo.ch}} Several executives of the bank confirmed to her that sales service proposed by Swiss client advisors is illegal in France.{{cite web|url=http://londonprogressivejournal.com/article/view/2069/the-big-banks-organise-massive-tax-evasion-on-an-international-scale|title=The Big Banks Organise Massive Tax Evasion on an International Scale|work=London Progressive Journal}} They further explained that [[UBS]] France has implemented a parallel accounting named "milk notebook" that gathers on a monthly basis the tax evasion transactions of French clients to offshore locations.{{cite web|author= |url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/2015/03/05/uk-france-ubs-ag-idUKKBN0M122P20150305 |title=French court rules UBS bullied ex-employee | Reuters |publisher=Uk.reuters.com |date=2015-03-05 |accessdate=2015-08-19}} [[UBS]] France tried to dismiss her in 2009 but the dismissal was refused. In 2010, [[UBS]] France filled in a complaint against her for defamation but lost their trial. She was finally made redundant in 2012.[https://archive.is/20150601132251/http://www.nytimes.com/reuters/2015/03/05/business/05reuters-france-ubs-ag.html?_r=1] As a [[whistleblower]] by the French labor inspection as of 2008 and by the public prosecutor when filling a complaint against her employer at the end of 2009, Stephanie Gibaud has been listened to by the brigade of repression of the crime against the people (BRPD, part of the French financial brigade) in February 2011 and in March 2015 and several times by the customs, judicial investigations in 2011 and 2012.{{cite av media|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DHLA0RYJ1iw|title=Another whistleblower offers to help government with black money probe|date=5 December 2014|work=YouTube}} She was also listened to by Belgian investigators as part of the indictment of UBS Belgium in July 2014 and several times in 2015.http://www.swissinfo.ch/eng/french-tax-evasion-_ubs-whistleblower-criticises-banking-s--code-of-silence-/40894464 In 2012, Stephanie Gibaud was listened to by Eric Bocquet, senator and reporter of the tax evasion commission{{cite web|url=http://www.senat.fr/rap/r11-673-1/r11-673-174.html|title=Commission d'enquête sur l'évasion des capitaux et des actifs hors de France et ses incidences fiscales|work=senat.fr}} and then by Yann Galut, deputy, in July 2013. Her name appears in the reports of the senate commission of inquiry dated July 17, 2012. and October 17, 2013{{cite web|url=http://www.senat.fr/rap/r13-087-1/r13-087-10.html|title=Évasion des capitaux et finance : mieux connaître pour mieux combattre (Rapport)|work=senat.fr}} In February 2014, she published "''La Femme qui en savait vraiment trop''" (the woman who knew too much) at the Cherche Midi publisher. She explains various dysfunctions of the bank, namely about the illegal sales service of the Swiss client advisors on the French territory and tax evasion.{{cite web|author= |url=http://blogs.mediapart.fr/blog/flo-genestier/130315/la-femme-qui-en-savait-vraiment-trop |title=La femme qui en savait vraiment trop |publisher=Blogs.mediapart.fr |date= |accessdate=2015-08-19}} Antoine Peillon, investigation journalist, who signed the postface of her book clearly explained that Stephanie Gibaud has been one of the sources of her book entitled "Ces 600 milliards qui manquent à la France"{{cite web|url=http://blogs.mediapart.fr/blog/antoine-peillon/060214/lanceurs-d-alerte-1-stephanie-gibaud-ubs|title=LANCEURS D’ALERTE -1 - Stéphanie Gibaud / UBS|work=mediapart.fr}} (these 600 billions which lack in France), published in March 2013. On march 5, 2015, the labor court ruled in favor of Stephanie Gibaud and condemned [[UBS]] to pay a fine of €30,000 for harassment.{{cite web|url=http://www.caravanmagazine.in/letters/france-wages-truth-whistleblowers-Europe|title=France - The Wages of Truth|work=The Caravan - A Journal of Politics and Culture}} The bank did not appeal the case.{{cite web|url=http://www.lesechos.fr/05/03/2015/lesechos.fr/0204204578268_un-lanceur-d-alerte-obtient-reparation-en-justice.htm |title=Un lanceur d'alerte obtient rĂŠparation en justice |publisher=Lesechos.fr |date= |accessdate=2015-08-19}} In May 2015, Stephanie Gibaud and her publisher received a complaint from [[UBS]] France for defamation.http://sans-langue-de-bois.eklablog.fr/stephanie-gibaud-lanceuse-d-alerte-ma-vie-apres-l-alerte-a117433046{{Dead link|date=June 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=no }} On May 11, 2015{{cite web|url=http://www.europarl.europa.eu/news/fr/news-room/content/20150511IPR54731/html/Taxe-accueil-chaleureux-pour-les-lanceurs-d'alerte-et-journalistes|title=Taxe: accueil chaleureux pour les lanceurs d'alerte et les journalistes d'investigation|work=Parlement européen}} she was being listened to by the tax ruling committee in the [[European Parliament]] in Brussels,{{cite web|url=http://www.europarl.europa.eu/meetdocs/2014_2019/documents/taxe/pv/1061/1061353/1061353fr.pdf |format=PDF |title=Parlement européen : PROCÈS-VERBAL Réunion du 11 mai 2015, de 14 heures à 18 h 30 BRUXELLES |publisher=Europarl.europa.eu |accessdate=2015-08-18}} invited by [[Alain Lamassoure]]. [[Eva Joly]], European deputy, who was seating in the commission, evoked her support to Stephanie Gibaud in an interview given to France Inter (radio) on January 24, 2015.{{cite web|url=http://www.franceinter.fr/player/reecouter?play=1039723|title=Player - France Inter|work=France Inter}} In June 2015, Stephanie Gibaud co-wrote a tribune in L'Express magazine with [[Nicolas Dupont-Aignan]]{{cite web|url=http://www.debout-la-france.fr/communique/nicolas-dupont-aignan-salue-la-decision-du-conseil-de-prud-hommes|title=Nicolas Dupont-Aignan salue la décision du Conseil de Prud’hommes|work=Debout la France}} to defend the cause of the [[whistleblowers]].{{cite web|url=http://www.lexpress.fr/actualite/la-france-doit-recompenser-les-lanceurs-d-alerte_1684518.html#comments_item|title=La France doit récompenser les lanceurs d'alerte|work=lexpress.fr}} On June 17, 2015, Stephanie Gibaud was officially received by Ricardo Etchegaray ([[AFIP]]) at the embassy of [[Argentina]] in [[Paris]]. She was listened to by the members of the bicameral commission of the argentinian congress.{{cite web|url=http://en.mercopress.com/2015/06/20/argentine-congress-members-in-paris-investigating-hsbc-with-whistleblowers|title=Argentine congress members in Paris investigating HSBC with whistleblowers|work=MercoPress}} who investigate tax evasion. She then asked Argentina to bring the question of the protection of the ones who put themselves in danger to protect the common good to the G20 == Publication == *''La femme qui en savait vraiment trop'', Paris, publisher Le Cherche Midi, published in 2014. == References == {{Reflist|colwidth=30em}} == External links == * {{Official website|http://sites.google.com/a/stephaniegibaud.com/stephanie-gibaud/home/}} * [http://www.afip.gob.ar www.afip.gob.ar] == Notes and references == {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Gibaud, Stephanie}} [[Category:French whistleblowers]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Public relations people]] [[Category:1965 births]] [[Category:Women whistleblowers]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=June 2017}} {{Use Indian English|date=June 2017}} {{infobox writer | name = Sudesh Sharad Lotlikar | image = | imagesize = 100 | alt = | caption = | pseudonym = | birth_name = | birth_date = 30 December 1964{{cite book|title=Who's who of Indian Writers, 1999: A-M|isbn=8126008733|page=675|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=QA1V7sICaIwC&pg=PA675&lpg=PA675&dq=sudesh+lotlikar+1964&source=bl&ots=i_u360YPHf&sig=wAHH_h3VA75hN4MW8eYeN9Of3gI&hl=en&sa=X&ei=KoPbUqjHN8ubiQeA8IHYCA&ved=0CEwQ6AEwBQ}} | birth_place = [[Ramnathi]], [[Bandora, Goa|Bandora]], Goa, India | death_date = | death_place = | resting_place = | language = [[Konkani language|Konkani]] | nationality = | citizenship = | education = | alma_mater = | period = | genre = | subject = | movement = | notableworks = Pois | spouse = Sharmila Lotlikar | partner = | children = Saurabh Lotlikar,
Saniya Lotlikar | relatives = | awards = | signature = | signature_alt = | website = | portaldisp = }} '''Sudesh Lotlikar''' ([[Devanagari]]: सुदेश शरद लोटलीकार) is an Indian [[Marathi language|Marathi]] and [[Konkani language|Konkani]] poet and producer/ director of documentary films from [[Goa]].{{cite book|title=A History of Konkani Literature: From 1500 to 1992|isbn=8172016646|page=180|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=1YILeUD_oZUC&pg=PA180&lpg=PA180&dq=sudesh+lotlikar+poet&source=bl&ots=Qs8jhQ8lDp&sig=RsszMREUQDhkp5xedt5J698yqxU&hl=en&sa=X&ei=iHrbUsr1NsSjiQf57YHACA&ved=0CFgQ6AEwCQ}}{{cite web|title='Eastern and Western Writers Meet' Today|url=http://www.navhindtimes.com/story.php?story=2009032185|accessdate=19 January 2014}}{{cite web|title=The Tradition Of Diwali Literary Supplements|url=http://www.navhindtimes.com/story.php?story=2008102731|accessdate=19 January 2014}}{{cite web|title=Reviving cultural traditions|url=http://www.india-seminar.com/2004/543/543%20d.%20mauzo,%20xavier%20cota.htm|accessdate=19 January 2014}}{{cite web|title=Festival of arts at Savoi-Verem today|url=http://www.navhindtimes.in/goa-news/festival-arts-savoi-verem-today|publisher=avhind Papers & Publications|accessdate=30 March 2014}} ==Awards & Recognition== * He was selected by the [[Sahitya Akademi]] (साहित्य अकादमी), India's National Academy of Letters, for producing and directing an English language short film based on the life of noted Konkani poet, [[Manohar Rai Sardesai|Dr. Manohar Rai Sardesai]]. It was the first short film of the Akademi based on the life of a Goan personality, encompassing the life and times of Dr. Sardessai. * He was also the recipient of Goa [[Kala Academy]] prize for his collection of poems "Pois" in 1990. * He received the Goa Kala Academy Best Book Award for the period 1990-1995.{{cite web|title=Konkani poetry, konkani poems, konkani poets|url=http://www.kavitaa.com/poet_poem.asp?poet=220&p_name=Sudesh%20Sharad%20Lotlikar|accessdate=19 January 2014}} * The Goa Hindu Association has presented Poet Laureate [[Padma Shri]] [[Balakrishna Bhagwant Borkar|B. B. Borkar]] Memorial Award to Sudesh Lotlikar in 1985.{{cite web|title=Cultural Activities : The Goa Hindu Association|url=http://www.goahinduasso.org/act_cultural5.php|accessdate=19 January 2014}} ==Earlier Work== * Sudesh Lotlikar had earlier produced a short film in Konkani based on the life of Dr. Sardessai for [[Panaji]] [[Doordarshan]]. * He has also produced short films on the lives of [[Shenoi Goembab]], [[Ravindra Kelekar]], [[Uday Bhembre]], D Harihar among others. * He has to his credit documentaries on [[Shantadurga temple|Shri Shantadurga temple]], history of Konkani language, [[Mahadev Temple, Tambdi Surla|Mahadev Temple at Tambdi Surla]], Goan [[Gowda (caste)|Gowda]] community and a tele-film on the [[Liberation of Goa]] - Mukti. * Ekantachim Utaram is another of Sudesh Sharad Lotlikar's Collection of Konkani Poems in Charity.{{cite web|title=Ekantachim Utaram -Sudesh Sharad Lotlikar Collection of Konkani Poems|url=http://www.ebay.in/itm/Ekantachim-Utaram-Sudesh-Sharad-Lotlikar-Collection-Konkani-Poems-/140935570905|accessdate=19 January 2014}} ==References== {{reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Lotlikar, Sudesh}} [[Category:Indian male poets]] [[Category:Konkani-language poets]] [[Category:Konkani poets]] [[Category:Konkani people]] [[Category:Poets from Goa]] [[Category:1964 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from North Goa district]] {{India-poet-stub}}

revision.text:
[[File:Susan Buchbinder.jpg|thumb|Buchbinder in 2011]] '''Susan Buchbinder''' is an [[United States|American]] [[physician]] who is best known for her work in [[HIV prevention]] and as a researcher in the [[HIV Vaccine Trials Network]].
==Professional history== Buchbinder serves as the research director on HIV for the [[San Francisco Department of Public Health]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.hvtn.org/about/buchbinder.html |title=Dr. Susan Buchbinder - HIV Vaccine Trials Network |first= |last= |work=hvtn.org |year=2011 |accessdate=17 November 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111002035220/http://www.hvtn.org/about/buchbinder.html |archivedate=2 October 2011 |df= }}</ref> She is on the HIV and AIDS editorial board of [[Medscape]].<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.medscape.com/public/bios/ed-hivaids |title=Medscape HIV/AIDS Editorial Board |first= |last= |work=medscape.com |year=2011 |accessdate=17 November 2011}}</ref>
Buchbinder was an investigator in the [[iPrEx]] study.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.gaycitynews.com/articles/2011/11/16/the_buzz/doc4ec3fd9459890834395691.txt |title=Chelsea Now > Does a pill a day keep HIV away? |first=Perry N. |last=Halkitis |work=[[Gay City News]] |date=16 November 2011 |accessdate=17 November 2011 }}{{Dead link|date=June 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=no }}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== *[http://cancer.ucsf.edu/people/buchbinder_susan.php profile at the UCSF Medical Center] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20111002035220/http://www.hvtn.org/about/buchbinder.html profile at the HIV Vaccine Trials Network]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Buchbinder, Susan}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:HIV/AIDS researchers]] [[Category:American public health doctors]]

{{Infobox theologian | honorific_prefix = | name =Tahupōtiki Wiremu Rātana | honorific_suffix = | native_name = | native_name_lang = | image = Tahupōtiki Wiremu Rātana.jpg | image_size = 250px | alt = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = 25 January 1873 | birth_place = | death_date = {{Death date and age|1939|09|18|1873|01|25}} | death_place = | region = | nationality = Māori | education = | occupation = faith healer, church leader, farmer | period = | notable_works = the Blue Book | influences = | influenced = | spouse = | children = | signature = | signature_alt = | signature_size = | era = | language = | movement = | tradition_movement = | school_tradition = | main_interests = | notable_ideas = | website = }} '''Tahupōtiki Wiremu Rātana''' (25 January 1873? – 18 September 1939) was the founder of the [[Rātana]] [[religion]] in the early 20th century in [[New Zealand]]. He rose to prominence as a [[faith healer]].
==Beginnings==
Rātana was of the [[Ngati Apa]] and [[Ngā Wairiki]] [[iwi]] — his subtribes were [[Nga Ariki]], [[Ngāti Hikapirau]], [[Ngāti Rangiwaho]], [[Ngāti Kiriwheke]] and [[Ngati Kauae]]. On his mother's side he was of [[Ngā Rauru Kiitahi]], his mother belonging to the [[Rangitaawhi]] Hapū.
He married Te Urumanao Ngāpaki Baker, who had whakapapa links to the [[Ngāti Ruanui]], and possibly [[Te Āti Awa]] also.
Rātana began his spiritual mission during the [[1918 flu pandemic|1918 influenza epidemic]]. He claimed that while standing on the veranda of his home at 2pm, on 8 November 1918, three days before the end of the [[First World War]], he saw a small cloud coming in from the sea toward his house. When the cloud 'broke open' he was overwhelmed by a presence and he rushed into the house declaring 'Peace be unto you all, for I am the Holy Spirit that speaks to you all. Straighten yourselves. Repent.' He was told the [[Holy Spirit]] was looking for a people through whom [[God]] could be truly known and accepted. The [[Māori people]] had not forgotten Jehovah and so they had been chosen to become an example to the world if only they would turn from their dependence on [[Tohunga|tohungaism]] (particularly the manipulative forms of witchcraft) and Maori gods. Rātana was told to unite the Māori and turn them to Ihoa o nga Mano (Jehovah of the Multitudes).<ref>Ratana the Prophet, Keith Newman, Penguin 2008</ref>
He continued his study of the [[Bible]] and began one of the most powerful faith healing ministries in New Zealand history. He gained a large following among Māori, becoming known as "Mangai" (a mouthpiece of God). A splinter group, called the [[Christian Maramatanga Society]], formed in the mid-1920s when they misinterpreted Rātana's call to 'close the Bible' in order to stop fanciful prophecies.
Variants of his name include Tahupōtiki Wiremu Rātana, Tahu Pōtiki Wiremu Rātana and T. W. Rātana.
==Politics== From 1922 onwards the Rātana movement became increasingly occupied with politics. The movement campaigned for ratification of the [[Treaty of Waitangi]] as a "cure-all" for Māori problems and collected 30,000 signatures on a petition calling for this. In 1928 Rātana proclaimed that Rātana candidates would win the four [[Māori seats]] in the [[Parliament of New Zealand]], likening them to the four parts of his body, or the Four Quarters, as the seats became known. [[Eruera Tirikatene]] arranged a meeting with [[Michael J. Savage]] in Parliament on 4 February 1936 at which an alliance with the [[New Zealand Labour Party|Labour Party]] was agreed. Savage's predecessor [[Harry Holland]] had been reluctant, because of the animosity between Rātana and the [[Māori King Movement]], especially Princess [[Te Puea Herangi|Te Puea]]. By 1943, the seats had been won, although Rātana had died in 1939.
==Legacy==
The Rātana Church remains one of the largest churches in Māori. The political links with the Labour Party remained strong for over 40 years, but were effectively divided by the rise of the [[Māori Party]], which was founded in 2004 and came to power in a [[confidence and supply]] agreement (with the [[New Zealand National Party|National Party]], Labour's traditional rival) after the [[Fifth National Government of New Zealand|2008 election]].

Ratana'' on the Rātana Church website] *[http://www.teara.govt.nz/1966/R/RatanaTahupotikiWiremu/RatanaTahupotikiWiremu/en Biography in the 1966 ''Encyclopaedia of New Zealand] *{{DNZB|id=3r4|title=Biography|plainlink=y}} in the ''[[Dictionary of New Zealand Biography]]''
